ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Standard L2 Material (more vocab, more videos, more songs)

I grew in my Hindi skills, building upon the knowledge taught in L1. I improved my reading, listening, speaking and writing skills by learning about the future, conditional, and perfective tenses among other things. I also learnt more about Indian culture, while having a lot of fun!
I expanded my knowledge of hindi vocabulary and grammar
Gained a deeper understanding of speaking and writing hindi.
I learned more grammar techniques in Hindi, elevated my vocabulary, and increased my proficiency in speaking this language on a day-to-day basis.
Solidified and enhanced the basis of Hindi grammar and vocabulary acquired in L1. We now have a level of command over all the tenses and more complex grammatical concepts.
Great continuation of Hindi L1! A little disorganized, but my knowledge increased a lot
I improved my Hindi. I'm better at speaking, understanding, reading, and writing than I was before taking this class.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Enjoyable class to look forward to, Swapna Ji very much cares about her students
Weaknesses: Fast paced, easy to fall behind

The course is wonderful! Swapna ji is such a good instructor, and the Rupert Snell book is engaging and helpful. It was also more organized than last semester, as our weekly plan was posted each week.
This course was structured well and class was informative and easy to follow.

Very strong course. The course allows you to learn at your own pace while still holding us to certain deadlines and checkpoints. Although language courses can seem overbearing, Hindi has been extremely insightful and enjoyable.

I think this class is excellent; our professor is excited about teaching and has been keeping the class informed ahead of time about what each week will look like. My only idea for improving this course is to introduce more practice of grammar techniques.

The main strength of this course is the daily practice in class. Each class we practiced the grammar from the chapter and often reviewed grammar and vocabulary from previous chapters. Hindi is a great language class because of the sense of community fostered in the class. The main weaknesses to this class are a degree of disorganization (though it is still much more organized than other classes I've taken) and a greater need for practice listening and speaking. Right now, I feel like my reading and writing abilities are much better than my listening and speaking abilities. There are opportunities to speak in Hindi in class, but the practice is not always structured to use the vocabulary we learned from the textbook, meaning people use lots of words in English, or we are given new words that we forget.

This class was a little weak organizationally, but part of that was because the instructor was overextended this year and it will probably be better next year. It improved this semester from last semester! This class has a really understanding teacher, and eases students into the material. Its also a great environment!

The class atmosphere was positive and it was a fun mix of lessons and videos and stories.

The class was disorganized, though -- sometimes frustratingly so. It's likely because Swapna ji had to teach all of the Hindi classes at the same time.

I really enjoyed the course and the mix of textbook, in-class, and partner-based exercises. I also really enjoyed the use of natural media (movies, videos, news clips, etc) for comprehension. My only suggestion is that I wish we had more opportunities for conversation in the class itself. Unfortunately, given my schedule with the School of Management, I could not routinely attend the additional conversation section and wish that I could have done so more.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you want to learn Hindi, take this course. It builds on L1 basics.

Yes, definitely! It's a great way to learn Hindi is a stress-free environment while also being surrounded by wonderful peers. Swapna Ji is awesome and facilitates a great classroom environment. It teaches you a lot of Hindi while also being a great classroom.
I would recommend this course as a follow up to hindi 110, as it is essentially just a continuation of the same course.

Yes. If youre thinking about learning hindi, I 100% recommend this course. The hindi department feels like a family with our different events, and the teachers really want to see you succeed. Ive learned a lot of hindi, and its been an amazing class.
Absolutely; I learned a lot of Hindi, found a community in my classroom, and had a great time doing it all.
If you want to learn Hindi, this is a great way to do it -- I have learned so much this semester and I'm excited to learn more.
Yes! Less difficult than other language classes
I would recommend it to a student who has a personal stake in learning Hindi because you will improve.
Yes, for anyone interested in Hindi I would strongly recommend taking the Hindi course with Swapna Ji.
